intro: Anisophyllum hyssopifolium, commonly known as the hyssop-leaved anisophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant features upright, branching stems covered in soft, hairy leaves that are lance-shaped and resemble those of hyssop. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. Anisophyllum hyssopifolium is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
